Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2014 01:46PM habibi7 wrote: thanks for the advice!  i actually haven't even heard from the surgeon yet!  i had my biopsy 11 days ago.  i was told i'd hear from him within 5 days after my biopsy.  i unexpectedly got results from my pulmonoligist on saturday and he recommended removing the mass as soon as possible, but i'd like to talk to the surgeon before scheduling anything.  i found out that there's a breast specialist a few blocks from me who seems to have a pretty good reputation, so i might try to go there.  hopefully i'll have a better experience with that doctor!  anyway, i hope all continues to go well for you! :)
Posts.Title: confused about biopsy results habibi7 marie5890

Posts.Content: habibi7 wrote: Hi everyone, I'm new here, so I hope I'm posting this in the right place!   A couple weeks ago, my pulmonologist found a mass on my chest CT.  He originally thought it was a lipoma, but when I went for my ultrasound, they said it was a solid mass (3.8 x 0.8 x 3 cm) and didn't look like fatty tissue.  The radiologist seemed a little dismissive because of my age, though (I'm 29).  However, my pulmonologist referred me to a surgeon who recommended I get a biopsy.  He thought maybe it was fibroadenoma.  I had a core biopsy last Thursday.  The bruising is way worse than I expected, but hopefully that's normal?  I can also feel the lump a lot more easily than I could before.  Anyway, I just got results this morning.  It says that it's dense stromal fibrosis with focal pseudoangiomatous stromal hyperplasia (PASH).  I still haven't seen the surgeon, so I'm a little confused.  I don't really understand what this is and I'm concerned because whenever I go for a different test, they tell me a different thing that they think the lump is.  I'm also concerned because my gynecologist did a breast exam in September and didn't find anything, so it seems like this lump must've grown pretty quickly.  Sorry if I'm rambling, but this is a lot of new information all at once and I just want to make sure I'm doing the right things.  I'm happy that the biopsy results were benign, but a little nervous because I'm not sure how much I trust the radiologist who did the biopsy.  If anyone could give me advice or direct me to some good resources that might help me gain a better understanding, I'd be very appreciative!   Thanks!!! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: confused about biopsy results habibi7 marie5890

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2014 03:59PM habibi7 wrote: Thanks to everyone for your information and advice.  I feel a lot better now that I have somewhat of a clue as to what my diagnosis means!  I actually got the results unexpectedly when I went to see my pulmonologist yesterday (he's the one who initially noticed a mass on my chest CT).  He didn't really seem to know much about it, so I left feeling really overwhelmed and confused.  Plus, he seemed very concerned about the amount of bruising and swelling and made comments that made it seem like he didn't think the biopsy was done very well.  I was probably just reading too much into things, though.  Anyway, I'm hoping to hear from the surgeon tomorrow, so I'll make sure I'm prepared with all the questions I want to ask.  He's a general surgeon, though.  Should I still seek the opinion of a breast specialist?
Posts.Title: confused about biopsy results habibi7 marie5890
